labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to facilitate UI design inspiration by searching high-resolution UI design references from Dribbble using keyword inputs. It leverages the Serper API to provide fast, filtered image results tailored to a user's design needs. This server is specifically geared toward designers who need quick access to high-quality design references, enhancing their design workflow.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the server—searching for UI design inspiration—clearly falls under gathered information and research, especially given its web-based nature. Browser automation is a secondary relevance as it indirectly involves querying web content through an API. "Web Search & Research" is the most accurate representation of its core purpose.

server_info_crawled.overview: Search for high-resolution UI design inspirations from Dribbble by simply entering keywords. Quickly get quality web app design references tailored to your needs. Enhance your design workflow with fast, filtered image results powered by Serper API.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@TriangleLabs/mcp-ui/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: serperApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Serper API key for image search
